intro: Ecbolium laetum, commonly known as the golden tansy, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in open woodlands and grassy areas. Ecbolium laetum is known for its aromatic properties and has been used historically in herbal medicine.
